Title: This Wearable Isn't Telepathic, but It Knows What You Want to Say

Title: The new Miss America said she was able to graduate from college '100% debt-free' because of pageants
Description:
Cassie Donegan won a $50,000 scholarship after being crowned the new Miss America.
The actor and singer told Business Insider she is debt-free.

Title: People are losing jobs due to social media posts about Charlie Kirk
Description:
Some GOP officials want to clamp down on perceived expressions of schadenfreude about Charlie Kirk's death.
Conservative activists are publicizing social media posts that are "celebrating" his death.

Title: Does adding football help colleges with recruiting? It's complicated
Description:
Some colleges, seeking to attract more male students, are adding the sport.
Research suggests the gains may be short-lived.

Title: Who will take home an Emmy this year? We make 3 predictions.

Title: He's a billionaire who never went to college. Here's how Don Vultaggio made his fortune.
Description:
Don Vultaggio cofounded AriZona iced tea in 1992 after running a beer-distributing business for 20 years.
He's worth nearly $6 billion.

Description:

Title: How Charlie Kirk's influence with younger voters helped Donald Trump: ANALYSIS
Description: Kirk energized young voters, and persuaded GOP leaders to buy into his vision.

Title: The Ritual of Civic Apology
Description:
More than a century after driving out their Chinese residents, cities across the West are saying sorry, with parks, plaques, and proclamations, Beth Lew-Williams writes.
But it’s seldom clear who they’re talking to—or what they’re remembering.

Title: ICE agent shoots dead man who tried to drive at agents, officials say

Title: Scientists Map Nightlife and Communication of NYC Rats to Help Urban Planning and Pest Control
Description:
A new preprint field study reveals that New York City’s rats aren’t just survivors—they’re talkative city dwellers with their own hidden nightlife.
Mapping their movements and conversations could offer insights to transform urban planning and pest control

Title: Students protest, Cumberland University cuts ties with employees over ‘inappropriate’ Charlie Kirk posts
